title.narrative: Emergency Infrastructure Preservation & Vulnerability Reduction Project

description.narrative: The Project Development Objectives are to preserve key lifeline infrastructure and reduce household vulnerability in targeted areas.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 - Section I.B.5 (b) | Description :The Recipient, acting through PN-BVPI, shall enter into twoagreements, each inform and substance acceptable to the Association, with FAO, one for the provision of technical assistance andone for the provision of goods and related services (collectively, the "FAOAgreements". | Due Date :31-Jul-2013

title.narrative: Hectares to be treated/protected by the locust campaign
Number of people in rural areas (fokontany) who gained access to an all-season road
Length of bridges rehabilitated/constructed (in linear meters).
Communes covered by functional flood or cyclone early Warning Systems
Modular bridges acquired or reconstructed (in linear meters).
Communes covered by the emergency interventions of four regional equipped structures.
Area provided with irrigation and drainage services - Improved (ha)
Beneficiaries of Safety Nets programs - Female (number)
Participants in consultation activities during project implementation - Cash-for-Work
Functional weighing stations managed by ARM.
Average yield per hectare in irrigated rice production in Project-intervention irrigation sites
Number of additional classrooms built or rehabilitated at the primary level resulting from project interventions.
Health facilities constructed, renovated, and/or equipped (number)
Percentage of registered complaints that have been addressed by local community or by FID in less than two months (citizen engagement indicator)
